topic.title: BitTorrent-Powered ZeroNet Decentralized Web Pioneers Peer-To-Peer Internet

topic.title: THE ZERONET INTERVIEW: RETHINKING THE INTERNET
Can Blockchain Technology Decentralize the Web?
10 easy steps to convert Manjaro Linux installation back to native Arch Linux
The FBI might soon be allowed to hack any computer in the world

8_13dUD5qbY6LaXH9pfh5iDgXHgKjCZPxvZV.body:
> [darkmatter](#comment_7_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): Why you guys not just install native Arch Linux directly?

I have installed native Arch Linux in my VAIO :D

> [darkmatter](#comment_10_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): I have used Arch for a really long time. But I switched  to Gentoo very recently and don't wanna go back.

I have a long time not using Gentoo... Why do you go back Gentoo?

> [darkmatter](#comment_11_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): I hate the endless updating in Arch. It's driving me crazy just like OCD.   XDD

endless updating? How often did you update...

> [darkmatter](#comment_12_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): Almost every other day.

Oh my god... every day
After installing Gentoo, how often do you update?

> [darkmatter](#comment_15_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): Did you get a notification after someone respond your post in zeronet?

I following this post, so if someone respond, I can see in feed ;)

> [darkmatter](#comment_15_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): Did you get a notification after someone respond your post in zeronet?

I send zeromail to you~

> [darkmatter](#comment_16_1GaejKrF2nq2BCEktthhK11jfxLi2GsboU): Opps. :)  I am really stupid.

haha it's no problem :D

1_1M5gEZBRPpw1aistyGj66SkLi3muDxcf3V.body:
> [redacted](#comment_23_19qsuxKBkNZWYft3epWgn6u3gG82sQHs6n): I haven't seen videos in ZeroNet yet. ZeroNet is not very well suited to videos because of the 10MB default site limit. IPFS is a better bet for storing videos, though one could easily put an index of IPFS-hosted videos in ZeroNet. I'll let you know if I run across such a thing.

[Stream Video with IPFS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiAFnnf6kb2G1GzDV1FhttTWNxCa4mShn/?Post:24:Streaming+with+IPFS:+HowTo,+Pt.2)

> [redacted](#comment_23_19qsuxKBkNZWYft3epWgn6u3gG82sQHs6n): I haven't seen videos in ZeroNet yet. ZeroNet is not very well suited to videos because of the 10MB default site limit. IPFS is a better bet for storing videos, though one could easily put an index of IPFS-hosted videos in ZeroNet. I'll let you know if I run across such a thing.

[Stream Video with IPFS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiAFnnf6kb2G1GzDV1FhttTWNxCa4mShn/?Post:24:Streaming+with+IPFS:+HowTo,+Pt.2)
